All Centenary students have the opportunity to begin their college careers in Paris, France through our one-of-a-kind Centenary in Paris program. But for many students, this is just the first of several global experiences at Centenary and beyond.

Centenary students received over $9.6 million in institutional scholarships and grants during the 2016-2017 academic year. Visit Centenary's Office of Financial Aid to learn about merit scholarships, need-based aid, out of state grants, and more.

The Centenary College Annual Security and Fire Safety report includes statistics for the previous three years concerning reported crimes that occurred on campus; in certain off-campus buildings or property owned or controlled by Centenary College and on public property within, or immediately adjacent to and accessible from, the campus. The report also includes information and institutional statements concerning campus security, such as information concerning sexual assault, and other matters. You can obtain a copy of this report by contacting the Department of Public Safety or by visiting the
These are non-binding early application deadlines. Students applying by these dates receive priority admission and scholarship consideration.
Students who would like to be considered for our Scholar's Weekend competition must apply by the Early Action II deadline.

Applicants meeting the Regular Decision application deadline will receive full consideration for admission and scholarships, while students submitting applications after this date will be reviewed on a space available basis.
Applications are typically processed and reviewed within two weeks. Notification of academic scholarships will be made separately.

along with your signed Candidate Reply Form to reserve your space in the entering class!
The deposit will be credited to your account in the

All admitted students who submit enrollment deposits will be considered provisional students until a final, official high school transcript indicating high school graduation date (mailed directly from the high school to Centenary) is received.
Admission to Centenary is conditional and can be revoked by the College if students experience a significant decline in their academic performance in high school after having been admitted.
Filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) makes you eligible for all federal financial aid programs as well as Louisiana's TOPS scholarship. Centenary's FAFSA code is 002003.

Rigorous coursework and close mentoring relationships with professors propel Centenary students to successful careers in medicine, law, business, the arts, and non-profit work. 90% of Centenary students who apply to medical school are accepted, along with 80% of those who apply to law school. But no matter which path they choose,

There are three easy ways to apply to Centenary! Apply using the common application, our online application, or our printable PDF application.
Apply Early Action or Regular Decision - we will let you decide!
Here's everything you need to know about applying to Centenary!
Want to learn about academics, global study, student life, and more at Centenary? We'll send you some things!
Exploring Centenary's beautiful campus is the best way to decide if this is home. Register for an open house, special event, or personalized tour with our Admission staff to see for yourself.

With a wide variety of financial aid options available, Centenary students graduate with student debt that is 30% below the national average. And a Centenary education is a wise investment - more than 80% of the Class of 2015 is pursuing graduate study or working in their chosen field.
A student who has withdrawn from Centenary and who wishes to return must complete a
, which is available in the Admission Office. Priority application deadlines are July 1 for the Fall semester, December 1 for the Spring semester, and May 1 for the Summer terms.

1.       Along with the application form, all readmit applicants must submit a letter informing the Admission Office of his/her activities since leaving the College and why it is their wish to return.
2.       Applicants must also supply a letter of recommendation from a professor at Centenary who previously taught them.
3.       Applicants who withdrew for academic reasons may be required to meet with the Assistant Provost for Student Support before being admitted.

4.       Students who are readmitted after leaving for academic reasons must complete an action plan developed by the Assistant Provost for Student Support. Each studentâs action plan will lay out specific steps that the student will take to improve his/her academic performance and return to good standing.
5.       Students must be cleared of any academic, financial, or conduct holds before enrolling.
**If you have attended any other institutions since you left Centenary College, we will need official transcripts sent from the college(s) attended.**
